comments.html:
According to Cisco (CCNP ISCW), you also need a hostname defined to enable SSH.

I'd validate but I don't have a router handy right now.
comments.name: Mao

comments.html: You're absolutely right; you need a hostname, otherwise the router cannot generate the certificate with the RSA keys. Stupid me ... I always use the hostname, so I've simply skipped it. Fixed the post.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Ahh ... a little bit of consistency would be so refreshing :)
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Hi, All!

Is it possible to substitute username and password with RSA keys when I use SSH on cisco routers?
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: YES, AAA requires you to use two factor authentication so its not an option. You can use either "login local" or "AAA."  Personally, I am going to use AAA because it can authenticate against local AND group (TACACS+) accounts. However, I looked at three Cisco white papers and all of them did a poor job of explaining how to make AAA work with local database accounts. I finally found my answer on this site.
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: I'm also interested in knowing if it is possible to automate login to cisco devices, for ex. not using passwords but ssh keys, like in linux.
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: @Anonymous#3: No. IOS supports only username/password authentication.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Where does the key get stored? NVRAM?

We've noticed, just pasting the same config into a new router, SSH is not enabled, you have to re-generate the key. I was wondering if there was a way to save everything to swap out the router.
comments.name: Mel Chandler

comments.html: Private keys are usually stored in protected part of the NVRAM and cannot be transferred to another device; that's why it's so important to create an exportable key and export it to an external location when deploying SSH or certificates on a router.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Can SSH works without local username & AAA, but only with "password" config under "line vty 0 4" ?
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html: you can use the "login local" command after the "vty line x x" command
comments.name: Anonymous
